title: (29200) Antequera - 6A Calle Fresca
description: Dusty and spacious parking lot. There is an area where there is shade from trees. It's easy to get to but be careful with browsers that get you into trouble. It is next to the old town and close to the citadel and the collegiate church. There are supermarkets, bars and all kinds of businesses next door

title: (29200) Antequera - 4 Calle Sagrado Corazón de Jesús
title_short: (29200) Antequera - 4 Calle Sagrado Corazón de Jesús
description: Large parking next to the bullring. when the area is complete it can be used as an alternative.

title: (29200) Antequera - 32 Calle Belén
description: Parking gravel, flat, non-noisy. Ideal for large motorhome. Walking tour of the city without difficulty. At this season, we slept there.

title: (29200) Antequera - 4 Calle Saeta
description: Beautiful place. Located directly under the Alcazaba de Antequera, quiet at night and in the middle of the remarkable white town. Entrance a bit tricky. No services available. In the bar La Socorrilla right at the entrance there are free wifi and delicious tapas!

title: (29200) Antequera - Puerta de Sombra
description: Where there is a source of drinking water

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7282
description: Parking day and night in the fairgrounds, it is quiet and 10 minutes walk from the center

title: (29200) Antequera - 25 A-343
description: Laundry near the motorhome area

title: (29200) Antequera - 42 Calle Jesús
description: Beautiful monuments. Easy parking and FREE. in Jesus street.

title: (29200) Antequera - 12 Arrabal S.gener.adscritos a S.u.p
description: Parking to visit the castle and town, some stay overnight. Very wide and flat.

title: (29200) Antequera - 36 Calle Escultor Diego Márquez
description: Alternative parking to the AC area.

title: (29200) Antequera - 10 Arrabal S.gener.adscritos a S.u.p
description: Parking above the city with a superb panoramic view

name: Area Autocaravanas Antequera
title: (29200) Area Autocaravanas Antequera
description: Urban area behind football stadium and sports complex. 16 designated parking for Motorhomes which are sometimes used by local cars. Lovely historical part approximately 1km from Aire.

title: (29200) Antequera -
description: No services. The steep access slope and a little broken. Pity how dirty the perimeter is.

title: (29200) Antequera - 2H Calle F
description: Near the motorhome area, if the area is full, it is a good alternative, about 200 meters from it, about 300 meters from the shopping center and about 50 meters there is a utility room with a very useful pet wash area.

title: (29200) Antequera - s/n Cuesta de Talavera
description: Parking from shopping center and Carrefour for first night or emergency okay. Night was quiet. Free Wi-Fi from Carrefour. Cheap gas station. WC open from 10.00 - 22.00 clock. Parking in the rear of advantage.

title: (29200) Antequera - 1 Calle Bernardo Simón de Pineda
title_short: (29200) Antequera - 1 Calle Bernardo Simón de Pineda
description: Economy gas station with possible free water filling

title: (29200) Antequera - 6 Calle Málaga
description: It is forbidden to spend the night. Ok during the day. clean toilets available.

title: (29200) Antequera - 3 Calle Doctor Diego Aragon
description: Laundry 2 x 18kg. Dryers, washing machine, table for folding laundry and seats pmis TV to watch. Very clean place.

title: (29200) Antequera - 8 Cuesta de Talavera
description: Place where there is a source with drinking water

title: (29200) - 169 Calle K Sup
description: Parking day and night in a very quiet area without traffic. A little shade for the summer, a trash can.

title: (29200) Antequera - 4 Calle las Adelfas
description: Coin-operated car wash for motorhomes/caravans. No height limit, 4 part washing programs.

title: (29200) Antequera - 9 Avenida del Romeral
description: Parking day and night. Quiet

title: (29200) Antequera - 1 Calle el Efebo
description: Gas station with lavomatic.

title: (29200) Antequera - Cerro Romeral
description: It is the parking lot to visit the Dolmen, in fact it puts tourism zone and bus zone, but we were able to park to visit this Dolmen, see the schedules before. If you could not park on the premises a few meters before there is a large and free area of land. The visit is free.

title: (29200) Antequera - 11 Avenida Poeta Muñoz Rojas
description: Place where there is a source with drinking water

title: (29200) Antequera - 3 Calle Doctor Juan Herrera
description: Place to wash motorhome, trucks etc. Google maps appears as Sánchez & Romero cistern laundry is in Antequera

name: Hotel Los Dólmenes
title: (29200) Hotel Los Dólmenes
description: Parking of the Hotel Restaurant Los Dólmenes, we have a large video-monitored parking where you can park and spend the night the motorhomes. Free WIFI. We have a restaurant and cafeteria from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. Gas station 50 meters. Antequera 3 km

title: (29200) Antequera - 38 Calle Infantería de Marina
description: Very quiet parking, next to the hospital

title: (29200) Antequera -
description: After a short km leaving the main road, pebble road, easily passable with motorhomes. Arrival on an esplanade at the foot of the cliffs. Super view, without nuisance.

title: (29200) Antequera -
description: Pretty little corner, on flat ground at the edge of the forest road. Relatively ok access in dry weather, probably more difficult in rainy weather. Shadow. Very quiet, passage of a few cyclists and hikers. Watch out for thistles!

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7075
description: Quiet place for overnight between Antequera and El Torcal. At night almost no traffic.

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7075
description: Stay at the feet of El Torcal. Good free place, water point in one of the fields, can come close by. Big screw tap (non standard).Other near the road is turned off. Bbq only October-March. Cristal clear river and swimming area perfect for summer. Hiking around - beautiful area.

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7075
description: In the middle of nature, it is also used by Spaniards to camp on weekends. Not for large motorhomes because it is a dirt road, not recommended when it rains (risk of getting stuck bezset) Please take rubbish with you!

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7075
description: Small area of firm ground alongside the A7075. The road is very close but has limited traffic. The location is suitable for smaller campervans and and could park 2 with ease. There are no services so be sure to take your rubbish with you on leaving.

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: Fabulous car park on the way up to Torcal de Antequera. In front of a viewpoint, a good place, quiet and sheltered from some winds.

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: 1 place on the side of the road up to el Torcal (7-8min from the site), above an abandoned sheepfold, with magnificent views! slightly sloping, but adjustable. a lot of wind (as in the area apparently!) Only 2 cars passing on the road, due to the low season I imagine. (February) Probably not tolerated in high season.

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7282
description: The perfect place to start your ascent to El Peñon De Los Enamorados.  The access is slightly rocky, but easy.  Larger campers should have no problem with access.  Calm all night long.  In the morning, a beautiful view of the mountain.

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: The Torcal car park, the use of the toilets and the cafeteria from 10 a.m. also make it possible to see animals very early in the morning or very late at night. Mountains are very unique. Easy access even with 8m.

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7075
description: Slightly sloping day parking. little passing.

title: (29540) Antequera - 7 Diseminado Poligono 253
description: Drinking water source with room to stop the AC without problems

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7075
description: Water source and parking, with fantastic views, near several hiking trails around el torcal de antequerra.

title: (29200) Antequera - A-7075
description: Parking with tables and trees to eat and spend the night. A water tap is available for washing dishes, if ecological product because the water is evacuated in nature as well as a toilet, with paper, which works.

title: (29230) - 51A Diseminado Poligono 154
description: Parking area of the hotel restaurant. lots of lorries parked opposite. I was as the motorway services area arrives about 11pm as not having any luck finding anywhere.  The police appeared and escorted me here as on my own and safer.  Road noise but fine for the night and by a restaurant for breakfast.

title: (29230) - 151C Diseminado Poligono 154
description: Repsol Sprint gas station. A small parking behind the station (more secluded, some 5 spaces) and a big area in the front where you can easily park too. Toilets and showers, small shop at the station, bread baked on site. Beautiful views of the mountains around. Not super silent at night since the motorway is close but calm and dark enough to sleep comfortably. There's a drinking water fountain and a small fruit/vegetable market on the other side of the road, by the La Yedra Hotel/Restaurant.

title: (29540) Antequera - 68 Diseminado Poligono 108
description: Fill up water for free. there is also small drain (not official gray water drain), for small camper its ok tp drain their gray water i think.

title: (29230) Villanueva de Cauche - 2 Diseminado Poligono 157
description: Flat pitches in a small recess with a beautiful view of the mountain 2 km from the entrance to the park. It is an excellent alternative to the roadside parking that the Torcal park guards systematically offer us. In the heart of nature, the owner (shepherd) who lives 200 m away gave us permission. Leave an access to the fields behind and leave the place perfectly clean. Superb 90-minute walk in the form of a loop starting on the left path and returning directly to the location (well indicated on google maps !!!)

title: (29230) - 58A Diseminado Poligono 154
description: La Yedra hotel car park, there is a fountain with public drinking water, ample parking with trucks and vans. There is a shop (market type), with little things to eat (fruit and cold meats) and pottery, the little shop is open 24/7. Apart from the hotel bar, which offers good breakfasts and has a lunch menu. It is on the side of the road and there is a lot of noise, but (despite that) it is quiet.

title: (29230) Antequera - 5 Calle 5
description: A good water fountain with an incredible view while refilling

title: (29230) Villanueva de Cauche -
description: Small flat area with a view of the mountains, good reception, 4x4 vehicle necessary,

title: (29230) Antequera - 28B Cortijo Collado Palomo
description: Ample parking between a playground and the largest road in this town. Also close to a gas station (expensive) with restrooms. The park also has a toilet and a drinking water source. Safe place, although not quiet.

title: (29230) Antequera - 6 Cortijo Collado Palomo
description: Drinking water source. With good current and with ample parking right next to it. On the same promenade, some 100m further on, there is a game park with another filling point.

title: (29230) Villanueva de la Concepción - 20 Calle Alora
title_short: (29230) Villanueva de la Concepción - 20 Calle Alora
description: Parking place behind the gas station. Asked if we could stay here at the gas station. He said the place is public to park and safe. Decided to stay the night. Was quiet except for the sounds of animals. Great view in the morning. Toilets available at the gas station if really needed. :)

title: (29540) Antequera - 103 Diseminado Poligono 72
description: Plateau off the quiet road, overlooking a beautiful valley. Close to the Lobo Park (Wolf Reserve). No services, please take your litter with you. Possible to park with larger motorhome. Fairly level on the top.

title: (29314) Archidona - A-7282
description: The showers and toilets were very clean. Staff also great.

title: (29230) Antequera - 1 Diseminado Poligono 53
description: Perfect to stop at the ascent of the pedrizas port. A bit dirty but it has a fresh water fountain. Please, if they stop, take away the dirt that they can put on, there are some bottles and trash out there, I always take a couple of bags with me when I stop.

name: El Puerto del Jaral
title: (29312) El Puerto del Jaral
description:
"El Puerto del Jaral" is a 130 year old, secluded cortijo (farm) surrounded by nature, olive and almond trees.
Only 3 km from the A-92M, Málaga - Granada.
There is room for 2 campers.

Reservation required, see contact

There is the possibility to receive a relaxing healing session / chakra healing / sound healing upon booking, see contact.
Welcome, Franck and Martine

title: (29312) - 106 Diseminado Diseminados
description: THE PLACE: Fully fenced private estate, ideal for safe parking and enjoying the incomparable natural surroundings. WARNING: The entrance is somewhat complex and has some unevenness, so it is not suitable for low or too long vehicles. THE SERVICES: The car park is not completely flat, but people who have tried it have found it comfortable enough. We can offer water, electricity for charging (not for permanent use) and we have a separate toilet, although hot water is not currently running. ABOUT US: We are a couple who love nature and the quiet life, we love to welcome travellers to travel through their stories. We are new to the platform and for sure we have a lot to learn and improve. Our dog, Pancho, is very noble and does not generate problems with other dogs, although he does not like cats very much. WHERE WE ARE: We are only 3 km from exit 16 of the A-92M motorway in a place of easy access (there are only 100 metres of dirt road in good condition). CONSULT AVAILABILITY: WhatsApp or Email.

title: (29532) Mollina - 2 Poligono UR.I.1 Caseria del Rey
title_short: (29532) Mollina - 2 Poligono UR.I.1 Caseria del Rey
description: Parking.

title: (29540) Antequera - Carretera de Antequera
description: Ample parking behind a gas station, surrounded by olive groves and wheat fields. Clear view of the mountain and the fields. Flat and spacious terrain. tap with water

title: (29200) Antequera - A-45 Autovía de Málaga
description: Service station with the essentials to continue, open 24 hours and with a mini supermarket. Quiet at night and 20 minutes from Malaga.

title: (29240) Valle de Abdalajís -
description: A very comfortable place to picnic and sleep, with water and barbecues, and is also very quiet. A bit hilly acces but very quiet in night.

title: (29312) - 17 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Gas station with very clean bathrooms and showers and a bar, open all night, we have spent the night here and it is very quiet. Recommended for a stopover or when passing through for a night

title: (29531) Humilladero - Unnamed Road
description: Good place to stop to rest, 5 minutes from the highway exit. Large picnic area in the middle of a pine forest. Avoid on weekends. We spent the night during the week and was very quiet.

title: (29160) Casabermeja - AP-46
description: Repsol gas station. Truck park and possibilty sleep midst trucks. Free shower. Ask key at gas stations desk. Not clean but will do. Friendly worker

title: (29531) Humilladero - 4 Calle Liebre
description: Motorhome car wash

title: (29531) Humilladero - 104 Calle Marcelino Camacho

title: (29531) Humilladero - 4 Calle J a Bardem

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: Folow the old road to the station, quiet place

title: (29160) Casabermeja - 38 Calle Avenida de los Pradillos
title_short: (29160) Casabermeja - 38 Calle Avenida de los Pradillos
description: Large level and paved parking. To sleep, very quiet, we were alone. The very interesting town, the cemetery, and the excursions with Luis "Curruco" with the collaboration of the town hall. To spend the day. The town has different bars and restaurants that are not expensive.

title: (29230) Antequera - 49 Diseminado Diseminados
description: There is only water and place for parking. Water but it’s a little bit hidden under the cover next to the house (look at the picture).

title: (29312) Málaga - 2T Terreno Pp. R
description: We spent one night but the place is fine with no problems. Via two motorhomes and two vans and without problem next to the sports area of Villanueva del Rosario there are swings for children the town is asphalted 200 meters shops and bars good place to spend the night

title: (29593) Álora - 206 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Nice place with good views all around. On a gravel side road near the ruin of a house. Only had lunch here but would definitely stay overnight if convenient. Only suitable for smaller campers.

title: (29300) Archidona - 17 Calle Blas Infante
description: Free municipal area for 10 motorhomes. The water tap does not work, you have to go to the local police. Although it is next to the road it is a quiet place. Ideal for visiting the ochavada square.

title: (29300) Archidona - s/n Calle Blas Infante
description: Next to the police station

title: (29532) Mollina - A-92
description: Hot showers, clean, there is a tapas cafeteria right next door

title: (29532) Mollina - A-92
description: Service station with cylinder, Cepsa of propane and butane, and water to refill

title: (29300) Archidona -
description: The Saucedilla! Rural Tourism House. Car parking, motorhomes, caravans and camper vans.

title: (29312) Villanueva del Rosario - 12 Calle Arroyo
description: Location easily accessible from the highway, plenty of room, very quiet at night, perfect for a overnight stopover. There are garbage cans at the end of the street. Cars and walkers start to pass around 7: 30-8: 00 on weekdays, the rest of the night, not a noise. View of the mountain and the village which looks rather cute.

title: (29150) El Curato - MA-3403
description: It looks like a waste ground for a pilgrimage, near Almogia. It has no services but it is quite level

title: (29312) Villanueva del Rosario - 116 Calle Arroyo
description: Source of water "old source". Clean source and very good water.

title: (29160) Málaga - 8 Terreno Pp. 4A Venta la Huerta
title_short: (29160) Málaga - 8 Terreno Pp. 4A Venta la Huerta
description: Gas station with car wash for tall vehicles, with platform. It has a parking area for long vehicles.

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: Great spot with an epic view. close to the road but not much through traffic. It was a bit windy here so you might want to check the weather if you are planning on cooking or eating outdoors.

title: (29160) Casabermeja - 4 Calle Picasso
description: Parking space without v / e, standing at ground level possible. Short ways to the monumental monument San Sebastián (cemetery).

title: (29532) Mollina - MA-703
description: Quiet spot outside the picnic area. spent one night no problem. trees for shade. room for 5 vans. level ground and easy access

title: (29532) Mollina - MA-701
description: Recreational area of ​​Santillán. Recreation area of ​​the village of Mollina 5 km from the city. Very calm during working days. Drinking water, barbecues, tables and services.

title: (29160) Casabermeja - 70 Calle Picasso
description: Large car park next to the cemetery to visit it, this is the most beautiful in Spain, quite quiet

title: (29312) Villanueva del Rosario - Unnamed Road

title: (29160) Finca Colores
description: Escape to a natural paradise at our picturesque campsite, where fruity delights, birdsong and refreshing dips in the pool await. Kudos to our lively bar creating memories to last a lifetime

title: (29300) Archidona - 5 Calle Lavanderos
description: Very quiet place to sleep

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Just off the road, slightly screened, road noise not a problem as it’s a very quiet road. Amazing sunsets, no services but near hiking paths. Please take your rubbish with you.

title: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - 88 Calle Campillos
description: Parking in quiet place

name: Camping Fuente de Piedra
title: (29531) Camping Fuente de Piedra
description: Fuente de Piedra, 85 Calle Campillos. Rural campsite of Fuente de Piedra. Good welcome. no motorhome service. Small pitches with shade, noisy swimming pool.

title: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - 15 Calle Garcia Lorca
title_short: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - 15 Calle Garcia Lorca
description: Free water at gas station

title: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - Calle Ancha
description: Parking in the city center of the beautiful little village. That is until they decide to forbid campers to use it because of stupid people who behave like this.

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: Very beautiful, with a reservoir and without problems to spend the night. Ample space, silent in the middle of nowhere and very appealing. Amazing views, I hope you like it :)

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Access only with 4x4. Quiet place among olive trees overlooking the water, we spent the night with a roof top tent and we had no problem. We did pick up some paper but it is very clean overall.

title: (29310) Villanueva de Algaidas - 2 Avenida Escultor Berrocal
title_short: (29310) Villanueva de Algaidas - 2 Avenida Escultor Berrocal
description: RV park with service point outside the village center, easy to find with the coordinates. November 2022, the supply and disposal area has been redesigned, water is available with good pressure

title: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - 47 Calle la Roda
title_short: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - 47 Calle la Roda
description: Quiet parking

title: (29150) Almogía - 815 Diseminado Diseminados
description:
Just outside the village of Almogia.
ideal for camper vans only.  We are about 30 km from the airport. Cash only.
Check in from 5 pm to 7:30pm, 
check out by 11am. No more then 3 nights a week allowed.
Registration at check in requires your ID.

 Shower 4€,
1 person and his van 7€, every extra person 4€. Dog 3€. Washing machine 45 minutes wash 4€.
 
Thank you!

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: Fantastic view of the reservoir. One place. Maximum 7 meters in length. The night very lonely and calm. The route is close to the road, but in 16 hours we counted only 3 cars. There is also a path that leads to Det Lake, however, seems to be only passable by Vans or 4x4.

title: (29552) Álora - 25 Diseminado Poligono 2
description: Small area presumably made for and used while resurfacing the road. May still be in use during the week. Seems fine for parking at the weekend, didn’t stay for the night.

title: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - 21 Calle Pilar Bardem
title_short: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - 21 Calle Pilar Bardem
description: Parking in quiet place

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Very nice spot on the side of the road but very little traffic at night, breathtaking view of the lake... for the anecdote, a fox visited us to snack...

title: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - Unnamed Road
description: Parking lot of the lagoon stone fountain visitor center. Free visit of the center, walks around the lagoon (not very attractive, really). And bird observatory.

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Flat spot next to the road but really quiet at night. Suitable for 1 or 2 vans. Beautiful view over the lake. Nice sunset. 4G good. It’s nature so keep it clean!

title: (29533) Los Carvajales - 35 Barriada los Carvajales
description: Water hole in the village with 2 exit points

name: Casa La Paz
title: (29552) Casa La Paz
description: A bit remote but beautiful place in the mountains near the Caminito del Rey. Access via dirt roads a bit bumpy, only suitable for smaller campers. Note the small signs "Casa del Paz". 15 mins walk to local bar and restaurant. 3 km from El Chorro train station giving access to the coast and surrounding tourist sites.

title: (29150) Almogía - 4 Calle Don Diego Gaitan San Esteban
title_short: (29150) Almogía - 4 Calle Don Diego Gaitan San Esteban
description: Flat parking, quiet and comfortable. 5 minutes from the historic center.

address.street: 4 Calle Don Diego Gaitan San Esteban

name: Finca la Campana
title: (29552) Finca la Campana
description: Finca la Campana offers space for approximately 15 mobile homes. You can use a lot for this: there is a large common room with sofas, a pool table, a table tennis table and table football, a large kitchen and a pizza oven outside. There is a small climbing wall, a slackline, a trampoline and a swimming pool. the owner is very friendly and uncomplicated. The driveway and parking spaces are designed for smaller motorhomes, but up to 6m can be accommodated well.

title: (29313) Villanueva del Trabuco - A-7203
description: Gas station with showers

title: (29313) illanueva del Trabuco - Crta de Granada, Km 7
title_short: (29313) illanueva del Trabuco - Crta de Granada, Km 7
description: Showering is possible here. Ask at the bar in the restaurant of the Repsol petrol station - then up the stairs on the right and the first door on the left. A whole room with shower, toilet and hairdryer. water is hot! staff very nice!

title: (29320) Gobantes - A-7286
description:
Super quiet during the week! Please keep the place clean and do not use camping chairs etc.
On weekends there are a few local fishing spots here.

title: (29552) Álora - 45 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Very good water. If you turn around bravely and have the right water -thiev you can even fill your tank.

title: (29552) Álora - 45 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Small place near road, for 3 vans or shorter campervan. There are few places along road used by climbers. Quiet at day, very quiet by night. No services at all.

title: (29552) El Chorro - Unnamed Road
description: Dirt parking right next to the via Ferrata and climbing routes, as well as the train tracks. There’s a VERY bumpy dirt track to get to the parking. You access by taking the tiny road just to the left of the La Estación De El Chorro snack place, just before the road turns left down to the bus stop and eventually kiosk from caminito del rey. Keep driving down the tiny road, past a small disabled car park, then turn right up the hill, when you get to a fork with a green sign, hand left and drive the dirt track all the way to the top. DEFINITELY not suitable for motorhomes, but a van or car with good ground clearance can make it. We had no problem with careful driving in an L4 Fiat Ducato (6m).

title: (29552) El Chorro -
description: Well with thread to connect a hose

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description:
Nice private spot just behind the road. Flat surface.

I did not stay here, I was in one of the spots earlier down the road but found this when hiking around.

title: (29552) El Chorro - 61 Barriada Estación del Chorro
title_short: (29552) El Chorro - 61 Barriada Estación del Chorro
description: Drinking water tap.

title: (29150) Almogía - A-7075
description:
Parking next to a flow meter.
I have not seen any kind of sign prohibiting overnight stays.
The noise of the stream is heard.
Close to the road.
It is entered by a dirt road .

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: Just near El Chorro great mountain spot to park! Quiet

title: (29552) Alora, Andalusia - 12 Diseminado Poligono 24
description: path

title: (29312) Villanueva del Rosario - Unnamed Road
description: Parking area for cars, intended for hiking trails. Close to the town of Villanueva del Rosario

title: (29552) Álora - MA-5403
description: Quiet, parking with a lot of shade. No swimming allowed in this lake as there are metal constructions in the water!

title: (29520) - Unnamed Road, 29520
description: A wonderful place to watch birds, just off the road and with good views onto the lagoon. There is a comfortable observation hut, but you can also observe directly out of the car. The overnight stay in the nature reserve is not allowed.

title: (29313) Villanueva del Trabuco - 29A Diseminado Poligono 11
description: If you let your camper ventilate at night by opening a window, several dogs will keep you awake at night. In the early morning cars, trucks and tractors drive past this place.

title: (29150) Almogía - A-7075
description: Quiet place next to the marsh of casasola.Almogia. without any service but with beautiful views. ideal place to rest and continue on a route of the towns of Malaga

title: () - A-6213
description: Overlooking the lake and surrounded by nature, free parking in the center of the park.Overnight prohibited

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: In the wind, there is a suitable place for about 5 vehicles, graveled, surrounded by trees, no services or prohibition signs or height limitation, cell phone good, some noise in the morning from planes that drive to Malaga airport. Please leave clean again.

title: (29593) Bermejo - Tr.ª Chorro Bermejo
description: Drinking Water. No hose connector

title: (29320) Campillos -
description: With a fantastic view of the lake, next to the road but very quiet.

title: (29150) Almogía - A-7075
description: Turn off the main road and follow the track down a slope and over an old bridge. Flat ground, further from the road and more secluded than the other one. Wouldnt recommend in the wet or with a large motorhome.

title: (29530) Alameda - 3 Calle Joaquín Blume
description: Very quiet parking, just behind the Guardia Civil barracks, very close to bars and next to the municipal sports center

title: (29320) Campillos -
description: View of the dam. Only one place available. Easy access by motorhome 6m50. Network okay

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: Nice quiet place protected from the wind, without any service!

title: (29320) Campillos - unamed road
description: Flat circular platform which must have been the foundation of some building a long time ago, next to a ruined house. Fantastic views to the lake. The access road although steep and dusty is actually not that bad for vans, probably a bit tricky for motorhomes however. There were a few midges buzzing around, annoying at worst. Mobile signal ok. If you follow the road opposite the platform, you can get to another spot by an unfinished house and also get acess to the lake but the locals know about this place and we saw a few cars going down in the night.

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: Very beautiful place, very windy, foxes come to visit you at night for food. There is a sign that says it is forbidden to camp with a fine. We were here last year and the reservoir is empty compared to last time.

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: Full land access at an angle because the road is elevated no problem with a van Large plateau with lake view

title: (29320) Campillos - Acceso Nte.
description: Small clearing near the road, close to two other open spaces indicated here on the site. Some points are flat and others are not, comfortable and quiet with some trees for shelter from the sun. Beautiful place.

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: Place high above the Embalse de Guadalhorce for max 3 vehicles next to the road. Quiet at night. No prohibition signs, no service. Mobile phone satisfactory

title: (29320) Campillos - Acceso Nte.
description: 5 pretty places where you can spend the day or the night. Close to the road but very quiet.

title: (29313) Villanueva del Trabuco - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place and lot of space. Nice wiew. Water is nearby

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-448
description: Mirador Tajo Encantada. Small parking and turning area as the road ends here. NOT recommended for overnight- stay! Just turn and drive back half the way to an official parking on your left (going down).

title: (29510) Álora - 161 Diseminado Poligono 8
description: Very isolated and calm place. Next to the hermitage, the three crosses. A magnificent view of the Guadalhorce Valley. Not recommended for motorhomes as the road is a bit winding.

title: (29170) Colmenar - 71 Carretera de Granada
description: Small and quiet parking.  We have spent the night without problem, near the center of the town of Colmenar.

title: (29552) El Chorro -
description: Superb view, place in the middle of nature, plan everything you need! Beware of tires, some rocks that come out of the ground, leave the place clean, this place is great! Accessible by a small path that starts from the road that goes up to the upper lake.

title: (29550) Ardales - 6 Barriada Pantano del Chorro
description: Quiet parking in the heart of nature

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-448
description: Parking just off the road.  Off season so very quite.   Great views and not much else.  Unsure if it’s ok for overnight.

title: (29550) Ardales - 5 Barriada Pantano del Chorro
description: Small corner in the nature above the lakes and dams and above the departure of the Caminoto del Rey. Access by an earth road upstream of the tunnel on the right downhill. Ideal for Van, delicate access for camper. View of the sunset, at the top. Quiet night. Sign prohibited to camp at the entrance of the dirt road, no problem in the off-season. Possibility to go even further on the parking of the mirador.

title: (29320) Gobantes - Unnamed Road
description: Parking for Caminito del rey. It’s near the north site witch it’s the start. Shuttle bus when you finish the Caminito del rey

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-448
description: Mirador to Bobastro in face el Choro... Water retention. Parking, flat. Beautiful, dominant view on the whole region. Close access but easy crossing road. Van 6 m.

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description:
Small place in the forest south of the car park already signposted by the roadside, passage of the GR340.
Forest path, possible access in vans, the CC may be a little high for the tree branches.
You can hear the road and air traffic in the evening and in the morning but no noise there at night.
We only stayed one night, we didn't see any parking restrictions, to check.

title: (29170) Colmenar - 1 Calle Carretera Riogordo
description: Small rest area for about 3-6 motorhomes, small to medium sized motorhomes. No services. No height restrictions. No signs prohibited. Located at the top of the village of Colmenar, facing a few residential houses. 10 minutes walk from a few restaurants and bars and a well stocked supermarket (closed between 2pm and 5pm) as well as a municipal swimming pool in the village. I spent one night there. Quiet (apart from the dogs barking) but waking up to a sunrise of this quality was worth the occasional sleep disruption. Many walks in this natural park.

title: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - Carretera del Cortijo de la Herriza
title_short: (29520) Fuente de Piedra - Carretera del Cortijo de la Herriza
description: Parking, no prohibition sign, no service or garbage at the viewpoint to the lagoon

address.street: Carretera del Cortijo de la Herriza

title: (29550) Ardales - 5 Barriada Pantano del Chorro
description: Off season parking from the Camino del Rey North, passed under the earth tunnel next to the restaurant, hard ground but not completely flat, possible to sleep there, arrival at night and I was not told anything, there is just enough room to turn around (with a H2L2 truck) and not too busy after 18:00 (that says in October), a lot of passages during the day to go to the trail. To go to the camino El Rey, remember to book at least a week before your ticket, otherwise you can have one of the 50 places available early in the morning, go to 7:30 / 8am, there are people even in the off season!

title: (29320) Gobantes - Unnamed Road
description: Unadorned spacious gravel roadside parking lot.

title: (29550) Málaga - Unnamed Road
description: There are 3 to 4 places along the road. Absolutely quiet in the night. 20mtrs from the tunel. Easy to find a place on Monday when Canimito is closed. You are then the closest possible to the entrance on Tuesday where we were shortly after 8 a. M. And we were lucky to be among the first ones in the row to get the few free tickets for the day. You can also enjoy swimming in the lake just about 50mtrs.

title: (29550) Ardales - El Caminito del Rey
description: Parking on the road, with two stands suitable for long campers and other places 4/5 small campers or vans. Views of the lake, the neighborhood is quiet, but in the open space there are buses that make maneuvering for a little blurry.

title: (29550) Ardales -
description: Parking to spend the night in the king's road is quiet for about four seats a bit on the slope ideal to leave the motorhome parked and go on foot to the meeting place of the route

title: (29550) Ardales - 26 Barriada Pantano del Chorro
description:
Parking on other side of dam close to camino del rey.
 Suitable for vw T5 size vehicles when the other side of the dam is full.
We had a drink and meal in the local hotel, friendly staff and good local information.

title: (29550) Ardales - El Caminito del Rey
description: Parking to visit the Camino del Rey 200m from the north access and 500m from the return shuttle stop, be careful it has arrived for luck if the cars do not take all the places. Three mobile homes are let in. Open from 8:30 a.m. Locked with a chain at night.

title: (29552) El Chorro -
description: Straight pitch under trees with a beautiful view

title: (29320) Gobantes - Unnamed Road
description: Excellent place to spend the day! (Only during the day! Closed at night!) They have tables and barbecues (not always enabled). you can rent kayaks, boats and paddle surf. cheap price!

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Stopping point to reach the caminito in 1.5 km. park off the road.

title: (29150) Almogía - A-7075
description: Take the second path, the one without concrete. Once at the top you have a beautiful place high up overlooking the lake! On the other hand we have the road next to it, but very little traffic in the evening. We are slightly visible from the road, but it is a very nice place.

title: (29311) - 5 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Casa Valle de Oro welcomes people traveling in their motorhome or motorhome (max 7 meters). No caravans. Maximum 2 people. Maximum 2 dogs, no cats. We have only 1 parking place between old olive trees, next to a gorge where a small river flows. Enjoy a wonderful holiday sheltered by beautiful olive trees, lounging by the pool or in the zen pool. Relax with a book from our library. Put on your hiking boots and explore the countryside. Take pictures of the beautiful surroundings. Or do nothing - nothing at all. Casa Valle de Oro is an idyllic spot in an unspoilt environment, perfect for stargazing. On our roof terrace you can enjoy beautiful views and spectacular sunsets. This is pampered camping and you are guaranteed to leave with charged batteries :-) . You can only use a private bathroom in the winter season. In the summer season this is only possible when a yurt bathroom is available. If not, there is an outdoor shower by the pool (cold water). There is a toilet room with sink (hot water). Electricity and water are free. Please check 1 day in advance for availability as we only have one motorhome pitch. Check in from 2pm - check out 11am

name: Camping Parque Ardales
title: (29550) Camping Parque Ardales
description: 15 pitches for motorhomes near the beach of a lake. Small but well maintained sanitary facilities. Avoid weekends as many dump stations visit Los Gaitanes Parade (3km from camp) convenience store. Staggered camping but fairly flat camping pitches.

title: () Alfarnate - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area surrounded by trees and with an arboreal adventure park managed by the "Los Pindongos" group. It is an esplanade with (closed) facilities that correspond to an old camping project. Magnificent area to spend a few days of hiking and adventure! Fairly quiet.

title: (29320) Campillos - Carretera de Antequera
description: Area with tables next to the road, and next to a lagoon, there are about 5 cement tables, all with shade, be careful the season in which you come, there are many mosquitoes. Noise of road cars, still good place.

title: (29220) Cuevas Bajas -
description: Parking area next to a picnic area! Right at the entrance to the town! If you find shade you will be very comfortable! We have stopped to eat and rest and we have not had any problems!

title: (29500) Álora - 119 Urbanizacion Ur. 2
description: Perfect parking with good views. Quiet area and close to Avda Cervantes, the main one of the town. Health center next door. Sports Center. Supermarkets Restaurants. Cervantes stationery-toy store very close. Spare parts nearby. No light, no water, no drains. Containers next.

title: (29313) Villanueva del Trabuco - 24 Diseminado Poligono 13
description: Recreation area. Next to the source of the 100 pipes, very pleasant.

name: Holiday Mountain
title: (29180) Holiday Mountain
description: Holiday Mountain is located on an estate surrounded by olive trees and is an ideal base to discover Andalusia. Beautifully situated in unspoilt nature. You can enjoy the swimming pool. There is also a toilet and a shower available.

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-5403
description: Nice wild spot with epic view of the lake! A bit windy but beautiful landscape.. The unpaved road is easy and short!

title: (29500) Álora - Lugar Conjunto San Jorge, 3
description: Nice drinking water. you can park right next to it to connect a hose to it.

title: (29500) Álora - 7 Calle Corta
description: Madese Self-Service Laundry - Lavomatic

title: (29320) Peñarrubia - Unnamed Road
description: Hidden cute place in the middle of nowhere. Great for fishing and peaceful rest.

title: (29320) Campillos - A-7286
description: Quiet site in the middle of two small lakes, where you can admire the fauna. We stayed one night without any particular problems. The street is next door but not too busy. The sounds of nature, bird songs and frogs are the only noise you can hear.

title: (29315) Archidona - 2 Urbanizacion los Eucaliptos SUR.S.2
description: Place with picnic tables, fountain, shadows, children's park, courts to play soccer and basketball, perfect for a stop, near the road junction towards Malaga if you come from Granada, all very clean and so we must leave it after use. good route

title: (29500) Álora - 240 Partido San José
description: Carmona street car park. Open space without light, water or drain. Monday from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. (street market). With night light of street lamps. Best place to park and go to the center of town. there is water and a gray water drain and WC. Overall fairly calm, there are worse. Be careful when you go up the hill, pick up speed, it is steep. flat parking with calles.

title: (29591) -
description: Spacious parking to park

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-5403
description: Parking only, along the road, quiet night no passage from 11:30 p.m. to 7 a.m.

title: (29510) Barriada Estación - 26 Calle Estación E
description: Large back of flat land. there are walks to do next to the river. Good internet coverage. easy access for all types of vehicles. people come for a walk and kids at night to make thrombos but it's not every day. I have had two good nights. in the neighborhood next door there are shops and bars to go on foot. It is not the quietest place because other people are the train that passes on the other side of the river

title: (29500) Álora - 1 Calle Benito Suárez
description: Drinking water fountain next to the church. Delicious without chlorine. Attention: access only suitable for vans, small streets.

title: (29320) Campillos - 3V Terreno UR-22
description: Good vacant land on the heights and not far from the village. A nice view of the lagoon. By cons quite noisy ... Troubleshoots well for one night.

title: (29194) Alfarnatejo - 2 Calle la Cuesta
description: Very close to the town, very quiet place next to the river with grass floor and trees

title: (29500) Álora - Unnamed Road
description:
Beautiful and quiet place, lonely with a beautiful view of the valley and town of Alora.
Just to rest under pine trees and enjoy. Two camping tables and a beautiful rock formation. Flat.
Path somewhat narrow but suitable for motorhomes up to 6 meters. It seems worse than it is.
No services, no water, just peace and very good internet.

title: (29315) Archidona - 56 Urbanizacion Ue. S3
description: Parking for cars, trucks and trailers. Also motorhomes.

title: (14910) Benamejí - Carretera Córdoba - Málaga
description: Small clearing on the shore of the Genil under the ancient bridge of the National Four. Get off just before the bridge to the left as you get off El Tejar. Beware of the current of the River.

title: (29194) Alfarnate - 41 Calle Río
description: Close to the village of Alfarnate on a not too noisy road, calm and quiet night but no service.

title: (29320) Ardales - Unnamed Road
description: It's a piece of road with a dead end towards the lake (depends on the water level how far you can go) on the way to this place (both sides) you have a dirt road with many other places to find! you can drive the dirt road for sure with your pickup truck. The exact spot in the picture doesn't have a view of the lake, it's just a really quiet spot! you can find spots with views in the area if you want.
